7dad970f-1841-489f-b154-187c399abc62.description: A certificate course in fintech offered by The FinTech Consortium Institute and Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business. By the time individuals finish this course, they will understand what fintech is, how it is disrupting financial services, and how they can be a part of this process. Individuals will learn about key fintech verticals such as: cryptoassets, digital banking, regtech, Islamic fintech, peer-to-peer lending, crowdfunding, insurtech, and more.
7dad970f-1841-489f-b154-187c399abc62.name: Georgetown Professional Development Certificate in Fintech Program

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Each team submits a 5-minute video summary of their findings and recommendations. The videos will be featured at the final showcase. Participants from the presenting teams will have the opportunity to engage with and get feedback from a small panel of venture capitalists and entrepreneurs from the GCC.

65d860aa-c9f7-4b22-9adf-e8089899f415.description: A virtual residency at Georgetown University. The main objectives of this study trip include 1. Deepen the knowledge on the challenges associated with international trade; 2. Further, understand the influence of transnational institutions on international trade; 3. Acquire new concepts in the area of business and government relations; 4. Develop and analyze non-market strategies for companies in a globalized context; and 5. Expand opportunities for networking with international organizations.
65d860aa-c9f7-4b22-9adf-e8089899f415.name: Washington Study Trip 2021 Business and Politics: International Trade, Non-Market Actors, and Non-Market Strategy

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

2eedf74d-4efe-42b3-801f-fcf7956f2bbf.description: Earners of this badge learned about the key components of non-market strategy, the implications of artificial intelligence for businesses, how to effectively manage crisis communication scenarios, and the application of strategy to an organization's competitive advantage. Throughout the week each student developed a crisis response plan for a hypothetical crisis scenario, which they presented as part of their group project to conclude the program.
2eedf74d-4efe-42b3-801f-fcf7956f2bbf.name: ESADE-Georgetown Undergraduate International Study Tour 2021

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Completed a group presentation based on applying crisis management best practices to a sample case.

728fc624-48f9-49eb-a172-99beaaa7dd31.description: This badge certifies that the earner has satisfied all requirements to graduate from the Georgetown Startup Interns program from Georgetown Entrepreneurship. They spent their semester working for a startup or high-growth company while participating in online skills workshops and career coaching. Students are competent in working in the fast-paced startup environment and have learned how to apply entrepreneurial thinking to add value to their workplace.
728fc624-48f9-49eb-a172-99beaaa7dd31.name: Georgetown Startup Interns

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

fa9a1bf9-986e-4783-967d-5a6470fe64d3.description: An 8-week immersive program in partnership with FINRA and Georgetown University that builds and expands knowledge and fluency in advanced analytics concepts, tools, and techniques. The program prepares students to lead, and contribute to, development of data-driven solutions that support regulatory decision making. The program covers data management, data visualization and storytelling, machine learning, predictive modeling, natural language processing, graph, and network analytics.
fa9a1bf9-986e-4783-967d-5a6470fe64d3.name: FINRA Data

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

7971f17d-75ba-4550-ae27-7e05d86a2ab4.description: Successfully completed GSA program through Georgetown Entrepreneurship’s Venture Lab. They spent 9 weeks learning how to take their venture to the next level, attended weekly workshops, worked 1-on-1 with experienced mentors to set short and long-term company growth metrics, and presented their companies to the Georgetown community and investors at Demo Day. They have a deep understanding of how to elevate their business and create a company that is more efficient, productive, and profitable.
7971f17d-75ba-4550-ae27-7e05d86a2ab4.name: Georgetown Startup Accelerator

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Nine weeks of learning, attending weekly workshops, one-on-one growth through mentoring and presentation.

e401ff16-ad1a-40c9-b1f0-445c16cb179e.description: Students gained a greater understanding of the entrepreneurship and innovation ecosystem in the United States. Students also studied artificial intelligence, sustainability, and communication and teamwork strategies. In addition, students met with new founders, visited startup incubators, and even got a behind-the-scenes look at the future of innovation at the KPMG private suite at Capital One Arena.
e401ff16-ad1a-40c9-b1f0-445c16cb179e.name: Pontifícia Universidad Católica de Chile + Georgetown University Study Abroad

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

307474f7-1900-4181-90d0-1bb0ba4b042b.description: The Duracell North America Senior Leadership Academy is completed over four days, each with a different focus. Sessions cover topics ranging from the business case for sustainability, effective decision making, and executive presence and virtual communication.
307474f7-1900-4181-90d0-1bb0ba4b042b.name: Duracell: Senior Leadership Academy

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Participants build upon practical skills and tools for day to day strategies related to communication and presence while exploring how they can incorporate and capitalize on environmental and social considerations in their business strategies, learn key insights from other industries, and discuss tactics on how to design sustainable supply chains and engage key internal and external stakeholders.

6547c325-7bf0-44a3-911d-ec6ab602e906.description: Participants have developed the skills to improve the quality of their decisions and learned tactics related to influence and power that support them in their day-to-day work. They now know how to avoid common decision-making errors, recognize systematic biases in their own decision-making, and improve their ability to manage group decisions processes. Specifically, how African American executives in particular can productively navigate micro-aggressions and increase their personal power.
6547c325-7bf0-44a3-911d-ec6ab602e906.name: LEAD360 - Power, Influence, and Decision Making Program at Georgetown University

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Participated and attended on-campus programming at Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business.

7f7dbaad-477b-499f-ace8-18ae9ebc8422.description: This badge certifies that the earner has successfully completed Georgetown Entrepreneurship's Georgetown Summer Launch Incubator. Students attended the program for four weeks and worked diligently on their startups—validating assumptions, conducting copious research, attending workshops, speaking with experts and finally pitching live in front of over 100 people. The Graduates from the Summer Launch Incubator are proficient in the lean startup model and are ready to take on the startup world.
7f7dbaad-477b-499f-ace8-18ae9ebc8422.name: Georgetown Summer Launch Incubator Alumnus

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Conducted customer interviews to validate their assumptions on who their consumer base is and what they need.
Created a business model canvas to organize all their information and discover where to take their startup next.
Attended a variety of sessions covering customer discovery, funding, marketing, pitching, product-market fit, team strategy, and more.

Pitched their startup in front of friends, family, the Georgetown community, investors, and the public. Students crafted a pitch explaining the problem they're solving, their solution, their research and work, and what they need next.

eacdb4eb-688c-4823-ba0e-9d378c9f0447.description: The earner has satisfied all requirements for the Entrepreneurship Minor from Georgetown University’s McDonough School of Business. They have taken three core courses plus on elective covering the startup journey—including ideation, validation, customer discovery, product-market fit, avenues for funding, scaling their venture, and more. Students have a holistic understanding of how to vet an idea and transform it into a successful business in order to solve our world’s biggest challenges.
eacdb4eb-688c-4823-ba0e-9d378c9f0447.name: Entrepreneurship Minor

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

entity.name: Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 3 courses and 1 elective on the startup journey.

af6a4744-ea14-4e76-9471-ba2dffadb497.description: The Grundfos Leadership in a Digital Age Program consists of three online modules with three distinct focuses: I. Influence and Persuasion, II. Mastering Difficult Conversations, and III. Leading with Emotional, Conversational, and Cultural Intelligence, as well as, a 5-day in person module. Over the course of the five in-person days, program participants engage in sessions covering a range of topics from creating a high-performance culture to grit and resilience and complete two site visits.
af6a4744-ea14-4e76-9471-ba2dffadb497.name: Grundfos Leading in the Digital Age Program

issuer.summary: issued by Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business

2107454b-d6ef-4482-ad43-c14edd758326.description: This badge Is awarded by Steers Center to MBA students at the Georgetown University McDonough School of Business. The Poland Family Real Estate fellowship Is based principally on the level of commitment that the individual demonstrates during their time at Georgetown McDonough to advancing the discipline of real estate through the Steers Center. Each fellow receives a $10,000 scholarship toward their educational pursuits in the MBA program.
2107454b-d6ef-4482-ad43-c14edd758326.name: Poland Family Real Estate Fellow

a7bc7d8b-a9c0-4140-a4bd-d08fe90b4ae6.description: Partipants in the Change Management Advanced Practitioner Program (CMAP) participated in nine-day comphrehensive, graduate-level change management program. Topics included business and change strategy, leadership and change, and human capital management, among others. The intensive program applied and integrated faculty and practitioner expertise in core change disciplines.
a7bc7d8b-a9c0-4140-a4bd-d08fe90b4ae6.name: Change Management Advanced Practitioner Program (CMAP)
